{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2016}} {{Use British English|date=September 2016}} [[File:Frederick Mahomed.jpg|thumb|The only known photograph of Dr Mahomed]] '''Frederick Henry Horatio Akbar Mahomed''' (11 April 1849 – 22 November 1884) was an internationally known [[United Kingdom|British]] [[physician]] from [[Brighton]], [[England]] in the late 19th century. == Family and Personal life == Frederick Henry Horatio Akbar Mahomed was born on 11 April 1849 in [[Brighton]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?cite=QhMooy34OHypWNdtj6fbAQ&scan=1|title=Index entry|accessdate=6 September 2018|work=FreeBMD|publisher=ONS}} He was the eldest son of Frederick Mahomed (1818–1888) and his second wife, Sarah Hodgkinson (1816–1905). He was also the grandson of the [[Bengali people|Bengali]] traveller [[Sake Dean Mahomed]].{{cite journal |author=Cameron JS, Hicks J |title=Frederick Akbar Mahomed and his role in the description of hypertension at Guy's Hospital |journal=Kidney Int. |volume=49 |issue=5 |pages=1488–506 |date=May 1996 |pmid=8731118 |doi= 10.1038/ki.1996.209|url=}} Frederick Akbar Mahomed's father, Frederick Mahomed, ran a [[fencing]], [[gymnastics]] and [[callisthenics]] academy in [[Hove]], which included [[boxing]] instruction. Cameron and Hicks dispute the suggestion that he ran [[Turkish bath]]s at Brighton{{cite book |title=Lives of the Fellows of the Royal College of Physicians of London, 1826-1925 |volume=4 |oclc=752408006 |contribution=Frederick Henry Horatio Akbar Mahomed |page=276 }} attributing this to a confusion of Mahomed's father Frederick with his uncle, Arthur. Mahomed had three brothers (Arthur George Suleiman, James Deen Kerriman and Henry), and one sister (Adeline). He was educated privately in Brighton prior to attending medical school.{{cite journal |author=Shaw AB |title=Frederick Akhbar Mahomed and his contribution to the study of Bright's disease |journal=Guys Hosp Rep |volume=101 |issue=3 |pages=153–73 |year=1952 |pmid=12989629 |doi= |url=}} On June 14, 1873 at the parish church of St Nicholas', Brighton, Mahomed married Ellen (Nellie) Chalk. The couple had two children, a son, Archibald in 1874 {{Cite web|url=http://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?cite=Rp9KeNvv8L1kLMmtY7z35Q&scan=1|title=Index entry|accessdate=6 September 2018|work=FreeBMD|publisher=ONS}} and a daughter, Ellen in 1876{{Cite web|url=http://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?cite=k8YexAx4tnHPKs59%2FR8sOg&scan=1|title=Index entry|accessdate=6 September 2018|work=FreeBMD|publisher=ONS}}. Only a month after the birth of Ellen in 1876, his wife, Ellen, died suddenly of septicemia {{Cite web|url=http://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?cite=rQBKe%2FUcwfVd3uL3nXqK7w&scan=1|title=Index entry|accessdate=6 September 2018|work=FreeBMD|publisher=ONS}} and Mahomed and his family moved in with his uncle, Horatio, also a widower, in Seymour Street near [[Portman Square]], London. In 1879 Mahomed married Ada Chalk, the younger sister of his first wife. As such a marriage was not legal under English law, the couple married in Switzerland.https://www.britishnewspaperarchive.co.uk/viewer/bl/0000098/18790419/008/0005 They lived at 12 [[Park End Street|St Thomas' Street]], close to [[Guy's Hospital]]. The couple had two daughters, Dorothy in 1880,{{Cite web|url=http://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?cite=a6amTf%2BtmpCE123oqYX3OA&scan=1|title=Index entry|accessdate=6 September 2018|work=FreeBMD|publisher=ONS}} and Janet in 1881,{{Cite web|url=http://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?cite=g%2BycTH1mP84LDskWOQXh%2BA&scan=1|title=Index entry|accessdate=6 September 2018|work=FreeBMD|publisher=ONS}} and a son, Humphry in 1883.{{Cite web|url=http://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?cite=ks0idyQO0frFHAMh6ESSBg&scan=1|title=Index entry|accessdate=6 September 2018|work=FreeBMD|publisher=ONS}} In 1884 the family moved from St Thomas' Street into a six-story Georgian house at 24 [[Manchester Square]]. Sadly, later that year, Mahomed contracted [[typhoid fever]], presumably from a patient at the [[London Fever Hospital]], where he was working. He died on 22 November 1884 from an intestinal [[Bleeding|hemorrhage]] and a perforated [[Gastrointestinal tract|intestine]]. He was buried at [[Highgate Cemetery]]. On his death a subscription was set up to assist his family and several notable physicians including [[William Gull|Sir William Gull]], [[Samuel Wilks|Sir Samuel Wilks]], [[James Paget|Sir James Paget]] and [[Elizabeth Garrett Anderson]] contributed. His oldest son, Archibald, later became a doctor, and in 1914 Archibald and the rest of the family changed their name to Deane (possibly acknowledging Frederick's grandfather's name, Deen) to lessen the impact of the [[xenophobia]] and [[Racism|racial prejudice]] associated with the outbreak of the [[World War I]]. Frederick's second wife, Ada Deane, died in New York in 1940.http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=93319315 Of Frederick's children, Archibald Deane died in 1948,{{Cite web|url=http://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?cite=vH6qef%2FtikbjT4C468H65w&scan=1|title=Index entry|accessdate=6 September 2018|work=FreeBMD|publisher=ONS}}, Ellen died in 1954,{{Cite web|url=http://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?cite=ec7zo45Hpm9ZKeMI83q8zQ&scan=1|title=Index entry|accessdate=6 September 2018|work=FreeBMD|publisher=ONS}} Janet in died 1955,{{Cite web|url=http://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?cite=%2FvzrdwvjdwA36mDWxhENSA&scan=1|title=Index entry|accessdate=6 September 2018|work=FreeBMD|publisher=ONS}} Humphry died in 1955 {{Cite web|url=http://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?cite=CPwYW%2BDR3mHHqdlXijJEXQ&scan=1|title=Index entry|accessdate=6 September 2018|work=FreeBMD|publisher=ONS}} and Dorothy died in 1962.http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=beresford&GSfn=dorothy&GSbyrel=all&GSdyrel=all&GSob=n&GRid=93319348&df=all& == Education and Career == [[File:Hand-book of physiology (1892) (14578601088).jpg|thumb|''Mareys Sphygmograph, modified by Mahomed''|alt=|left]] In 1867, aged 18, Mahomed began to study medicine at the [[Sussex County Hospital]], Brighton. Two years later in October 1869, he entered Guy's Hospital, London as a medical student.{{cite book|author=Samuel Wilks, G.T. Bettany |title=A biographical history of Guy's Hospital |location=London |publisher=Ward, Lock, Bowden |url=https://archive.org/details/biographicalhist00wilkuoft |ol=22852056M }} He was an outstanding student and, in 1871, won the student Pupils' Physical Society prize for his work on the [[sphygmograph]], having been runner-up the previous year. Mahomed qualified as a Member of the [[Royal College of Surgeons]] in 1872. Following qualification, Mahomed worked at Highgate Infirmary (St Pancras' North Infirmary, Central London Sick Asylum) for a year. In 1873, he was appointed as resident medical officer at the [[London Fever Hospital]] in Liverpool Street, [[Islington]]. In 1874 Mahomed became a member of the [[Royal College of Physicians]] and was appointed as Student Tutor and Pathologist at [[St Mary's Hospital, London|St Mary's Hospital]], [[Paddington]]. In 1875, Mahomed gained a doctorate (M.D.) from the [[University of Brussels]]. In 1877, he returned to Guy's Hospital as a Registrar (Senior Resident). He was elected as a Fellow of the [[Royal College of Physicians]] in 1880, and in 1881, he was awarded an [[Bachelor of Medicine|M.B.]] from [[Cambridge University]] for his thesis on "Chronic [[Bright's disease]] without albuminuria". In the same year, he was appointed Assistant Physician at Guy's Hospital and, in 1882, he was appointed as a Demonstrator in Morbid Anatomy at Guy's Hospital.[[File:Hand-book of physiology (1892) (14762065691).jpg|thumb|''Diagram of the formation of the pulse (Mahomed)'']]Mahomed‘s earliest contribution, while still a [[Medical school|medical student]], was to improve the [[sphygmograph]], a device for measuring [[blood pressure]] that had originally been devised by [[Karl von Vierordt]] and further developed by [[Étienne-Jules Marey]]. Mahomed’s major innovation was to make the sphygmograph quantitative, so that it was able to measure arterial blood pressure (in [[Troy weight|Troy ounces]]). The description of the modified instrument was published in 1872.{{Cite journal|last=Mahomed|first=Frederick|date=1873|title=The physiology and clinical use of the sphygmograph|url=|journal=Medical Times and Gazette|volume=2 (9 August)|pages=141–143|via=}} Following his graduation in the same year, Mahomed took up an appointment at the Central London Sick Asylum, where he worked with [[William Broadbent|Sir William Broadbent]], who became a strong supporter and friend. Several of Mahomed’s pulse tracings are contained in Broadbent’s classic book, The Pulse.{{Cite book|url=https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/982879476|title=PULSE (CLASSIC REPRINT).|last=H.|first=BROADBENT, W|date=2016|publisher=FORGOTTEN BOOKS|isbn=9781331197980|location=[S.l.]|oclc=982879476}} Mahomed used the new sphygmograph to measure arterial tension (blood pressure) in [[Bright's disease]] and a range of other conditions, including [[pregnancy]], [[scarlet fever]], [[gout]], [[Alcoholic drink|alcohol]] and [[lead poisoning]].{{Cite journal|last=MAHOMED|first=F|title=ON CHRONIC BRIGHT'S DISEASE, AND ITS ESSENTIAL SYMPTOMS.|url=http://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S0140673602459363|journal=The Lancet|volume=113|issue=2899|pages=399–401|doi=10.1016/s0140-6736(02)45936-3}} He found that in some individuals blood pressure was elevated before there was evidence of [[kidney disease]], assessed by measurement of protein in the urine ([[proteinuria]]). He also made the association between the elevated blood pressure and various [[Autopsy|post-mortem]] changes, including enlargement of the [[heart]] ([[Ventricular hypertrophy|cardiac hypertrophy]]), thickening and [[fibrosis]] of the [[Artery|arterial wall]], [[aneurysm]] formation, and damage to the [[microcirculation]] (arterio-capillary fibrosis). In effect, Mahomed was describing most of the key pathological effects of [[essential hypertension]] for the first time. Initially he termed this condition "Bright's disease without albuminuria" but later he described it as “high pressure diathesis”. His description of the condition is worth citing:
‘…the existence of this abnormally high pressure does not necessarily mean disease, but only a tendency towards disease. It is a functional condition, not necessarily a permanent one, though it is generally more or less so in these individuals. These persons appear to pass on through life pretty much as others do… As age advances the enemy gains accessions of strength; perhaps the mode of life assists him - good living and alcoholic beverages make secure his position, or head work, mental anxiety, hurried meals, constant excitement, inappropriate or badly cooked food, or any other of the common but undesirable circumstances of everyday life, tend to intensify the existing condition, or, if not previously present, perhaps produce it. Now under this greatly increased arterial pressure, hearts begin to hypertrophy and arteries to thicken; what has previously been a functional condition tends to become more of the nature of an organic one…’
Mahomed also proposed that reducing blood pressure would prolong life, although the means of doing that in his era were in the main limited to lifestyle advice. In 1880 Mahomed made a first foray into [[public health]].{{Cite journal|last=Hughes|first=Alun D.|date=2013-06-01|title=Commentary: ‘On the cards’: Collective investigation of disease and medical life histories in the nineteenth century|url=https://academic.oup.com/ije/article/42/3/683/912097|journal=International Journal of Epidemiology|language=en|volume=42|issue=3|pages=683–688|doi=10.1093/ije/dyt062|issn=0300-5771}} He wrote to the [[The BMJ|British Medical Journal]] to advocate undertaking the comprehensive systematic documentation of disease in Britain; he termed this idea, Collective Investigation. Mahomed’s proposals were warmly supported by [[George Murray Humphry|Sir George Murray Humphry]], the President of the [[British Medical Association]], and a Collective Investigation Committee was formed in 1881 with Mahomed as secretary. Around this time Mahomed became acquainted with the British polymath, [[Francis Galton]], who shared an interest in factors predisposing to disease. Mahomed and Galton collaborated to produce [[Compositing|composite photographs]] of over 400 patients with phthisis ([[Tuberculosis]]), which they compared with composite photographs based on 200 individuals without evidence of phthisis to test whether, as was widely believed, appearance or looks indicated a predisposition to disease. They found no evidence of a characteristic facial appearance associated with tuberculosis beyond some evidence of emaciation. In 1882 Mahomed advocated expanding Collective Investigation to include a general collection of detailed family life histories:
'for encouraging patients to keep carefully prepared records of their lives and of the chief incidents therein, both medical and otherwise. These records would prove of very great value, alike to the patient, to the doctor, and to medical science.'
A life-history subcommittee of the Collective Investigation Committee, including both Mahomed and Galton was formed in 1882. Initially the Collective Investigation Committee was very successful with 54 local Collective Investigation Committees being formed to collect data. Their preliminary findings were published in 1883 as a 76-page single volume called 'The Collective Investigation Record' and included results based on more than 2000 patients. In 1884, a Life History Album was published to allow parents to record details of family circumstances and child development. It was advertized in [[Nature (journal)|Nature]] and Galton offered prizes of £500 to people who submitted the most complete family records - within 5 months he had received in excess of 150 records. Over the subsequent 5 years data based on over 300 family records were published, with the main findings summarised in Galton’s book, Natural Inheritance. However, Mahomed would not see these achievements as he died in November 1884 from typhoid fever. ==Contribution== Michael F. O'Rourke summarizes the contributions of Frederick Akbar Mahomed as follows:{{Cite journal|last=O'Rourke|first=Michael F.|title=Frederick Akbar Mahomed|journal=Hypertension|year=1992|volume=19|publisher=[[American Heart Association]]|pages=212–217|pmid=1737655|issue=2|doi=10.1161/01.hyp.19.2.212|pmc=2308176}} {{quote|In detailed clinical studies, he separated chronic [[nephritis]] with [[secondary hypertension]] from what we now term [[Hypertension|essential hypertension]]. He described the constitutional basis and natural history of essential hypertension and pointed out that this disease could terminate with [[Hypertensive nephropathy|nephrosclerosis]] and [[renal failure]]. His clinical studies were done without the benefit of a [[sphygmomanometer]] but with the aid of a quantitative sphygmogram that he had initially developed while a medical student. He described characteristic features of the [[Pulse pressure|pressure pulse]] in patients with high blood pressure and in persons with [[arteriosclerosis]] consequent on aging. These [[P-wave|pressure wave]] changes have recently been verified and explained. He contributed to a number of other advances in medical care, including [[blood transfusion]] and [[Appendicectomy|appendectomy]] for [[appendicitis]]. He initiated the Collective Investigation Record for the [[British Medical Association]]; this organization collected data from physicians practicing outside the hospital setting and was the precursor of modern collaborative [[clinical trial]]s.}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==See also== *[[Sake Dean Mahomed]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Mahomed}} [[Category:Anglo-Indian people]] [[Category:English people of Indian descent]] [[Category:English people of Irish descent]] [[Category:British people of Bengali descent]] [[Category:Bengali people]] [[Category:Year of birth uncertain]] [[Category:1884 deaths]] [[Category:19th-century English medical doctors]]

{{Infobox person |name = Frederick C. Yeh |image = Frederick_C._Yeh_releases_rescued_sea_turtle_back_in_the_ocean_with_children,_Apr_2013.jpg |caption = Yeh releases a rescued sea turtle back in the ocean with disadvantaged children |alma_mater = {{plain list| *[[Johns Hopkins University]] *[[Duke University]] }} |occupation = [[social entrepreneur]]
[[conservation biologist]] |known_for = The unlikely sea turtle savior{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.com/travel/story/20150521-in-china-saving-sea-turtles-from-soup|title=The unlikely sea turtle saviour|first=Amanda|last=Ruggeri|date=|website=bbc.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}} }} '''Frederick C. Yeh''' is an [[United States|American]] [[social entrepreneur]] and [[conservation biologist]] who founded [[Sea Turtles 911]], a [[non-profit]] [[sea turtle]] rescue and [[conservation organization]] that operates in the [[United States]] and [[China]].{{cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/travel/article/china-hainan-sea-turtles|title=Could rare sea turtles return to the Hawaii of China?|author=|date=28 August 2017|website=cnn.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.globaltimes.cn/content/806004.shtml|title=Sea Turtles 911 dedicated to sea turtle conservation - Global Times|first=Global|last=Times|date=|website=www.globaltimes.cn|accessdate=21 September 2018}}http://en.visithainan.gov.cn/en/mt_newsview-1776.htmhttp://news.xinhuanet.com/english/sci/2013-09/03/c_132688041.htm{{cite web|url=http://english.people.com.cn/90882/8375839.html|title=Sea Turtles 911 dedicated to sea turtle conservation - People's Daily Online|first=|last=F_100542|date=|website=english.people.com.cn|accessdate=21 September 2018}}http://www.asamnews.com/2013/09/03/english-news-cn-chinese-american-dedicates-career-to-saving-endangered-turtles/ http://www.paulhiltonphotography.com/index.php/field-notes/30{{cite web|url=http://blogs.dw.com/generationchange/2011/11/saving-sea-turtles-in-hainan/|title=Saving Sea Turtles in Hainan - Uncategorized - Generation Change - DW.COM|author=|date=|website=dw.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dw.com/en/saving-endangered-sea-turtles-in-hainan/a-6665063|title=Saving endangered Sea Turtles in Hainan - DW - 22.11.2011|first=Deutsche Welle|last=(www.dw.com)|date=|website=DW.COM|accessdate=21 September 2018}}http://bestfriends.org/News-And-Features/News/China--Until-the-seas-are-safe-again/{{cite web|url=http://english.cri.cn/11354/2013/08/24/2561s783859.htm|title=Sea Turtles 911 Dedicated to Sea Turtle Conservation|author=|date=|website=english.cri.cn|accessdate=21 September 2018}} == Early life == Yeh attended [[Montgomery County Public Schools (Maryland)|Montgomery County Public Schools]], including [[Thomas Sprigg Wootton High School|Thomas S. Wootton High School]], and graduated from [[Johns Hopkins University]] and [[Duke University]]. In 2007, Yeh discovered that [[endangered sea turtles]] on [[Hainan|Hainan island, China]], were being sold illegally for their meat and shell. During an interview with [[CNN]], Yeh described, "I felt really hopeless at that time ... You would see land turtles and freshwater turtles (in the market) and some of those are legal, but when you see a sea turtle it's clearly not supposed to be there and that's shocking to see." This finding was emotionally disturbing to Yeh and became a turning point in his life, which led to the founding of the first non-profit organization working for the advancement of sea turtle protection and conservation in China. == Sea Turtles 911 == {{Main article|Sea Turtles 911}} [[File:Coast_Guard_Police_Rescue_Sea_Turtle_for_Frederick_Yeh.jpg|thumb|left|Frederick Yeh and coast guard police rescue a sick sea turtle.]] [[File:Sea_turtle_rehabilitation_with_fluid_therapy_by_Frederick_Yeh.jpg|thumb|right|Frederick Yeh provides medical treatments to a sick sea turtle.]] Despite the desperate state of sea turtles in China, Yeh was inspired in 2008 when he saw wild sea turtles undisturbed by people as the animals were naturally basking on public beaches in Hawaii.{{cite web|url=http://traveltips.usatoday.com/time-year-turtle-beach-oahu-106738.html|title=The Best Time of the Year for Turtle Beach, Oahu|author=|date=|website=usatoday.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.fpir.noaa.gov/PRD/prd_volunteer_opps.html|title=Home page of NOAA Fisheries Service - Pacific Islands Regional Office|first=US Department of Commerce, NOAA, National Marine Fisheries|last=Service|date=|website=www.fpir.noaa.gov|accessdate=21 September 2018}} As Yeh said on a CNN interview, "When you see the sea turtles in Hawaii, how great they are, it's worth it when you can envision that and hope that one day it will happen in Hainan, one day, in China." This experience led Yeh to believe that sea turtles and people could live in harmony and that there was still hope in China because of the successful sea turtle conservation efforts in Hawaii. According to the global authority on nature conservation, [[International Union for the Conservation of Nature]] (IUCN), the sea turtles of the Hawaiian Islands were also once under the threat of near [[extinction]], but are now thrivinghttp://www.whatsonsanya.com/news-20205-iucn-sea-turtles-911-release-tagged-sea-turtle-in-sanya.html{{cite web|url=http://news.mongabay.com/2012/0306-pod-seaturtle911.html#|title=Animal photos of the day: green sea turtle saved in China|author=|date=6 March 2012|website=mongabay.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}} and their conservation status reclassified as "Least Concern" according to the [[IUCN Red List]].{{cite web|url=http://www.iucnredlist.org/details/16285718/0|title=Chelonia mydas (Hawaiian subpopulation) (Green Turtle, Hawaiian Green Turtle, Tortuga Blanca)|author=|date=|website=www.iucnredlist.org|accessdate=21 September 2018}} Thus, Yeh established Sea Turtles 911 under Hawaiian jurisdiction, and changed the course of his life by moving to China to save the sea turtles he had hopelessly witnessed being sold, earning him the nickname "The unlikely sea turtle savior" by the [[BBC]]. Building a floating sea turtle hospital in a Chinese fishing village known for its extensive sea turtle [[poaching]], Yeh makes a point to work with people of all types to support sea turtle conservation in the area, including government officials, academia, fishermen and poachers, community members, local and international volunteers.{{cite web|url=http://www.china.org.cn/environment/2013-09/04/content_29924143.htm|title=Floating hospital saves sea turtles - China.org.cn|first=|last=弓迎春|date=|website=www.china.org.cn|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.upi.com/Science_News/2013/09/03/Floating-hospital-in-China-dedicated-to-caring-for-sea-turtles/UPI-18231378254043/|title=Floating hospital in China dedicated to caring for sea turtles|author=|date=|website=upi.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/xinhua/2013-09-03/content_10025472.html|title=Around China: Floating hospital saves sea turtles-chinadaily.com.cn|author=|date=|website=www.chinadaily.com.cn|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.hawaii247.com/2012/09/04/chinese-police-rescue-inouye-the-turtle/|title=Chinese police rescue Inouye the turtle|author=|date=4 September 2012|website=hawaii247.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}} At a sea turtle release event held at the [[Ritz-Carlton]], [[Sanya]], Yeh stated, "For our release events, if we can bring multiple sectors in our community together, it will be very beneficial to sea turtle conservation in China. It is my hope that we can put other issues aside and agree on sea turtle rights, for the advancement of sea turtle conservation."{{cite web|url=http://www.ioseaturtles.org/headline_detail.php?id=2207|title=Indian Ocean - South-East Asian Marine Turtle Memorandum of Understanding|author=|date=|website=www.ioseaturtles.org|accessdate=21 September 2018}}http://sanyaexpat.com/index.php/news-sanya-hainan-china-world-sanyabay-dadonghai-yalongwan-shimeibay-haitangbay-haikou-shanghai/seaturtles911-ritzcarlton-yalongbay-sany?blog=1 Local community members, including fishermen and coast guard police, describe Yeh as a true "[[Haigui]]" or a "returning sea turtle," and defer to his expertise when endangered sea turtles are rescued and in need of medical attention.{{cite web|url=http://www.hawaii247.com/2012/03/27/satellite-tagged-sea-turtle-released-in-hainan/|title=Satellite-tagged sea turtle released in Hainan|author=|date=28 March 2012|website=hawaii247.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}}http://www.whatsonsanya.com/news-20775-sea-turtles-911-release-satellite-tagged-sea-turtle-in-hainan.html == Activism == [[File:Frederick_Yeh_featured_in_magazine_as_public_figure.jpg|thumb|right|Local media featuring Frederick Yeh as a public figure who gives a voice to endangered sea turtles.]] Yeh promotes environmental conservation through publicized sea turtle release events in China, and is vocal about ending sea turtle [[Exploitation of natural resources|exploitation]] in Chinese media.http://hi.people.com.cn/n/2012/0327/c231190-16881075.htmlhttp://ep.chinaluxus.com/Act/20120828/215894.html#picviewhttp://roll.sohu.com/20120328/n339138562.shtml{{cite web|url=http://news.hainan.net/newshtml08/2012w3r27/855570f0.htm|title=海南新闻-海南新闻中心-海南在线 海南一家|author=|date=|website=news.hainan.net|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://news.hexun.com/2012-03-27/139763126.html|title=两百多斤海龟陵水搁浅 国际海龟保护组织放生-新闻频道-和讯网|author=|date=|website=news.hexun.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://v.hinews.cn/page-51659.html|title=3000斤鲸鲨误撞渔网 水生野生动物保护分会组织放生- 海网宽频|author=|date=|website=v.hinews.cn|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.hi.chinanews.com/hnnew/2012-07-05/244719.html|title=3000斤鲸鲨误撞渔网 海南动物保护会组织放生|author=|date=|website=www.hi.chinanews.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://ngdsb.hinews.cn/html/2012-07/05/content_495225.htm|title=南国都市报·数字报刊|author=|date=|website=ngdsb.hinews.cn|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://hnrb.hinews.cn/html/2013-08/11/content_2_5.htm|title=海南日报数字报-"大海才是你们的家"|author=|date=|website=hnrb.hinews.cn|accessdate=21 September 2018}}http://bbs.tianya.cn/post-838-34922-1.shtml As he has said, "Their survival is our responsibility; we must create hope."http://ep.chinaluxus.com/Glv/20120828/215879.html During interviews with journalists, he is known to use metaphors to facilitate the understanding of environmental conservation to the public. Yeh cautioned the Chinese public not to delay the increased protection efforts of sea turtles until they decline to the same population level as China's cherished [[Giant panda]].{{cite web|url=http://hnrb.hinews.cn/html/2013-08/14/content_4_1.htm|title=海南日报数字报-海龟濒危连问4个为什么|author=|date=|website=hnrb.hinews.cn|accessdate=21 September 2018}} In addressing [[marine pollution]] problems in China, he reminds the public not to treat the ocean as an enormous toilet and garbage dump. In China, poached sea turtles include endangered [[Green sea turtles]] raised primarily for consumption of their meat, and the [[critically endangered]] [[Hawksbill sea turtle]] raised for the trade in shell products such as jewelry, combs, eyeglass frames, and preserved trophies.{{cite web|url=http://www.theworld.org/2012/02/china-turtle-poaching/|title=Sea Turtle Poaching and High Demand in China|author=|date=|website=theworld.org|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.pri.org/stories/science/environment/high-demand-for-sea-turtles-in-china-sends-poachers-toward-philippines-8358.html|title=High demand for sea turtles in China sends poachers toward Philippines|author=|date=|website=pri.org|accessdate=21 September 2018}} During a speech condemning the use of sea turtle products, Yeh echoed [[Yao Ming]]'s famous quotation, "When the buying stops, the killing can too." Declaring July 4, 2012, as a day of freedom for all marine animals, Yeh led the release of an endangered [[Whale shark]] that had been caught accidentally by a Chinese fishing boat as [[bycatch]], as well as two Green sea turtles.{{cite web|url=http://www.hawaii247.com/2012/07/05/freedom-release-whale-shark-and-sea-turtles-in-china/|title=Freedom release: Whale shark and sea turtles in China|author=|date=5 July 2012|website=hawaii247.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}}http://www.whatsonsanya.com/news-22425-sea-turtles-911-releases-whale-shark-and-sea-turtles-in-hainan.htmlhttp://hotelhainan.com/sea-turtles-whale-shark-released-in-hainan/ At this event, he proclaimed, "Sea turtle conservation does not only involve sea turtles. When we protect [[charismatic species]] such as whale sharks, those efforts spill over and protect sea turtles as well. These two animals share the ocean, and we must learn to share the ocean with them.” Holding humans accountable for sea turtle and Whale shark endangerment, he added that, "protecting them is humankind's responsibility." [[File:Yao_Ming_and_Frederick_Yeh_release_endangered_sea_turtle_back_into_the_wild.jpg|thumb|left|Frederick Yeh and [[Yao Ming]], [[NBA]] basketball star and China's top celebrity, release an endangered sea turtle back into the wild during an event to raise public awareness for environmental conservation.]] On March 23, 2013, Yeh spoke out on [[climate change]] and [[global warming]] during [[Earth Hour]], the one hour when the [[World Wildlife Fund]] (WWF) encourages businesses and households worldwide to switch off their lights to raise awareness on climate change. Sea turtle eggs are influenced by a biological process known as [[Temperature-dependent sex determination]], meaning that their gender is determined by the environmental temperature.{{cite journal |pmid=7079758 | volume=216 | issue=4551 | title=Temperature-dependent sex determination: current practices threaten conservation of sea turtles | year=1982 | journal=Science | pages=1245–7 | last1 = Morreale | first1 = SJ | last2 = Ruiz | first2 = GJ | last3 = Spotila | first3 = JR | last4 = Standora | first4 = EA | doi=10.1126/science.7079758}} Yeh reminded the public, “As the global climate’s average temperature increases, more females will be hatched, jeopardizing sea turtle populations with an unbalanced sex ratio.”{{cite web|url=http://blog.mongabay.com/2013/04/05/sea-turtles-released-during-earth-hour/|title=Sea Turtles Released During Earth Hour|author=|date=|website=blog.mongabay.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}}http://roarhawaii.org/sea-turtles-released-during-earth-hour/ In an interview with China's official state-run news agency, [[Xinhua News Agency]], Yeh called for a celebrity to help save endangered sea turtles by raising public awareness. In 2014, Yeh was answered by former [[NBA]] basketball superstar [[Yao Ming]], who consistently ranked #1 on the [[Forbes China Celebrity 100]].{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/2009/03/18/chinese-celebrities-beijing-olympics-yao-ming-business-media-chinas-top-celebrities.html|title=Forbes China Celebrity List|first=Russell|last=Flannery|date=|website=forbes.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/china/2009-03/19/content_7594549.htm|title=Yao tops Forbes China Celebrity list for the 6th time|author=|date=|website=www.chinadaily.com.cn|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.china.org.cn/english/NM-e/86932.htm|title=Yao Ming Tops Forbes' China Celebrity List|author=|date=|website=www.china.org.cn|accessdate=21 September 2018}} Yao Ming joined Yeh in his public sea turtle release events and the duo set free rescued turtles back into the wild, raising awareness together that leads people to "an epiphany that turtles belong in the wild, and not in the market.”{{cite web|url=http://www.scmp.com/news/china-insider/article/1534600/former-basketball-star-yao-ming-calls-protection-sea-turtles|title=Former basketball star Yao Ming calls for protection of sea turtles|author=|date=|website=scmp.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.looktothestars.org/news/12172-nba-star-yao-ming-saves-endangered-sea-turtles|title=NBA Star Yao Ming Saves Endangered Sea Turtles|author=|date=17 June 2014|website=looktothestars.org|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.sci-news.com/biology/science-yao-ming-green-turtles-02025.html|title=Basketball Star Saves Endangered Green Turtles - Biology - Sci-News.com|author=|date=|website=sci-news.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ecorazzi.com/2014/06/18/former-nba-star-yao-ming-saves-sea-turtles/|title=Former NBA Star Yao Ming Saves Sea Turtles : Ecorazzi|author=|date=|website=www.ecorazzi.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ortablu.org/news/world-news/former-nba-star-yao-ming-saves-sea-turtles|title=Former NBA Star Yao Ming Saves Sea Turtles « Orta Blu|author=|date=|website=Orta Blu|accessdate=21 September 2018}} On June 8, 2015, Yeh led a large-scale event in which five (5) rescued sea turtles were released from different beaches around the island of Hainan to maximize conservation awareness for [[World Oceans Day]] as recognized by the [[United Nations]].{{Cite web|title = World Oceans Day - 8 June|url = https://www.un.org/en/events/oceansday/|website = www.un.org|accessdate = 2015-10-16|language = EN}} Yeh said, "The emotional experience of watching a sea turtle swim for freedom back to nature reminds us that we are all connected to the vast ocean expanse, and thus have the responsibility to protect them for our future generations.”{{Cite web|title = Sea Turtle 911 - World Ocean Day 2015 - World Ocean Network|url = http://www.worldoceannetwork.org/portfolio-posts/sea-turtle-911-world-ocean-day-2015/|website = World Ocean Network|accessdate = 2015-10-16|language = en}} [[File:US_Ambassador_Max_Baucus_and_Sea_Turtles_911_Frederick_Yeh_release_rescued_turtle.jpg|thumb|right|Frederick Yeh and [[United States Ambassador to China|United States Ambassador]] and [[List of United States Senators from Montana|former U.S. Senator]] [[Max Baucus]] release a satellite tracked sea turtle.]] On January 15, 2016, [[United States Ambassador to China]] and [[List of United States Senators from Montana|former U.S. Senator]] [[Max Baucus]] joined Yeh in the release of two rescued turtles named [[Harvard]] and [[Yale]] into the South China Sea.{{cite web|url=https://yalealumnimagazine.com/articles/4282-shell-game|title=Shell game|author=|date=|website=yalealumnimagazine.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://usa.chinadaily.com.cn/world/2016-02/03/content_23373150.htm|title=US ambassador sends New Year greetings in video-Americas-chinadaily.com.cn|author=|date=|website=usa.chinadaily.com.cn|accessdate=21 September 2018}} According to Yeh, the U.S. Ambassador’s charitable act was recognized as symbolic because "Sea turtles are charismatic, migratory animals that serve as natural ambassadors of the ocean; as communities and countries work together to preserve this flagship species for future generations, our shared mission to save sea turtles nurtures a peaceful platform of common grounds to improve community and international relations."{{cite web|url=https://ecopartnerships.lbl.gov/news/sea-turtles-911-and|title=Sea Turtles 911 and U.S. Ambassador Release Endangered Sea Turtles in the South China Sea - EcoPartnerships|author=|date=|website=ecopartnerships.lbl.gov|accessdate=21 September 2018}} ==Awards and honors== [[File:Gary_Locke_and_Frederick_Yeh_showing_support_for_sea_turtle_conservation_at_2018_conference_in_Silicon_Valley.jpg|thumb|left|Frederick Yeh and Ambassador Gary Locke, former [[United States Secretary of Commerce|U.S. Secretary of Commerce]] and [[List_of_Governors_of_Washington|Governor of Washington]], show support for sea turtle conservation at their committee meeting.]] On March 30, 2013, the [[Ministry of Agriculture of the People's Republic of China]] honored Yeh the 2012 [[Popular Science]] Award, in recognition for his significant contributions to public awareness of marine conservation.http://news.xinhuanet.com/local/2013-03/30/m_115219425.htm{{cite web|url=http://www.nawca.org.cn/haichang-2013/list.asp?unid=1642|title=全国水生野生动物保护分会 (Http://www.nawca.org.cn)|author=|date=|website=www.nawca.org.cn|accessdate=21 September 2018}} On January 9, 2015, the [[International Union for Conservation of Nature]] officially recognized Yeh as a marine turtle expert in the China region.{{Cite web|title = Member List by Country|url = http://iucn-mtsg.org/members/member-list-by-country/|website = IUCN SSC Marine Turtle Specialist Group|accessdate = 2015-10-16|language = en}} On June 22, 2015, [[Duke University]] awarded Yeh with the prestigious Global Fellowship in Marine Conservation.{{Cite web|title = 2015 Participants {{!}} Marine Conservation Summer Institute|url = http://superpod.ml.duke.edu/mcsi/2015-participants/|website = superpod.ml.duke.edu|accessdate = 2015-10-16}} On June 23, 2015, the [[United States Department of State]] and the [[National Development and Reform Commission]] supported Yeh to lead the [[China–United States relations|U.S.-China]] bilateral partnership to save endangered sea turtles.{{Cite web|title = US, China Broaden Collaboration on Climate Issues|url = http://www.voanews.com/content/us-china-broaden-collaboration-on-climate-issues/2834952.html|website = VOA|accessdate = 2015-10-16}}{{Cite web|title = U.S.-China EcoPartnerships Program|url = https://2009-2017.state.gov/r/pa/prs/ps/2015/06/244111.htm|website = U.S. Department of State|accessdate = 2015-10-16}}{{cite web|url=https://revitalizationnews.com/article/us-china-partnership-funds-program-rescue-restore-sea-turtles-hainan-island|title=US-China partnership funds the rescue and restoration of sea turtles on Hainan Island|author=|date=|website=revitalizationnews.com|accessdate=21 September 2018}} On July 28, 2015, [[National Geographic (magazine)|National Geographic]] interviewed Yeh as their Featured Explorer to inspire children to save sea turtles.{{Cite web|title = National Geographic Features Frederick Yeh to Inspire Children to Save Sea Turtles|url = http://www.seaturtles911.org/news/national-geographic-frederick-yeh-inspires-kids-save-sea-turtles.htm|website = NatGeo|accessdate = 2015-07-28}} On April 15, 2018, the [[Committee of 100 (United States)|Committee of 100]] officially recognized Yeh as their Next Generation Leader to advance the betterment of U.S.-China relations.{{Cite web|title = Announcing Committee of 100 Next Generation Leaders 2018|url = http://www.committee100.org/announcements/announcing-committee-of-100-next-generation-leaders-2018/|website = C100|accessdate = 2018-06-07}} Committee delegations have been invited to give briefings to top officials at the [[White House]] and [[Zhongnanhai]].{{cite journal | author = Qidong Zhang | date = April 25, 2014 | title = C-100 strengthens US-China relations | journal = [[China Daily]] | url = http://usa.chinadaily.com.cn/2014-04/25/content_17467034.htm | access-date = April 26, 2017 }} Prominent members of the committee include Ambassador [[Gary Locke]], former [[United States Secretary of Commerce]] and [[List_of_Governors_of_Washington|Governor of Washington]]; [[I. M. Pei]], renowned architect; [[Yo-Yo Ma]], master cellist; [[Jerry Yang]], Founder of [[Yahoo!]]; [[David Ho (scientist)|David Ho]], [[Time (magazine)|''Time'' magazine]]'s 1996 [[Time Magazine Person of the Year|Man of the Year]] for pioneering [[HIV/AIDS research]]; [[Michelle Kwan]], Olympic medalist in figure skating; and [[Steve Chen]], Founder of [[YouTube]].{{cite web | title = Committee of 100 Members | publisher = Committee of 100 | url=https://committee100.org/member-roster/ | access-date = April 11, 2018}} == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.seaturtles911.org/ Sea Turtles 911] {{DEFAULTSORT:Yeh, Frederick}} [[Category:Articles created via the Article Wizard]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Social_entrepreneurs]] [[Category:American conservationists]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox LDS biography | name = George P. Lee | image = George P. Lee.jpg | image_size = 150px | alt = Photograph of George P. Lee | birth_name = George Patrick Lee | birth_date = {{Birth date|1943|03|23}} | birth_place = [[Towaoc, Colorado|Towaoc]], [[Colorado]], United States | death_date = {{death date and age|2010|7|28|1943|03|23}} | death_place = [[Provo, Utah|Provo]], [[Utah]], United States | portals = LDS | position_or_quorum1 = [[First Quorum of the Seventy]] | called_by1 = [[Spencer W. Kimball]] | start_date1 = {{start date|1975|10|03}} | end_date1 = {{end date|1989|09|01}} | end_reason1 = Excommunicated}} '''George Patrick Lee''' (March 23, 1943 – July 28, 2010) was the first [[Native Americans in the United States|Native American]] to become a [[general authority]] of [[The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints]] (LDS Church).<ref name = nytimes/> He was a member of the church's [[First Quorum of Seventy]] from 1975 to 1989, when he was excommunicated from the church.<ref name = nytimes/><ref name = sltrib>[[Peggy Fletcher Stack]] and Kristen Moulton, [http://www.sltrib.com/sltrib/news/50019546-78/lee-george-lds-church.html.csp "Ousted LDS leader dies"], ''[[Salt Lake Tribune]]'', 2010-08-03.</ref>
==Early life== Lee was born in [[Towaoc, Colorado|Towaoc]], [[Colorado]], to Mae K. Lee ({{spell-nv|Asdzą́ą́ Łichííʼ}}) of the {{spell-nv|Tódíchʼíiʼnii}} clan, and to a Medicine Man, Peter Lee ({{spell-nv|Hastiin Jaanééz Yee Biyeʼ}}), of the Under the Flat-Roofed House People clan. One of 17 children from his parents' marriages, Lee was called {{spell-nv|Ashkii Yázhí}} (Little Boy), until he was given a sacred name, {{spell-nv|Ashkii Hoyáanii}} (Boy Who is Well Behaved and Good).
When he was 12 years old, Lee became one of the first children to participate in an official Indian foster placement program sponsored by the LDS Church.<ref name=Ensign>[http://www.lds.org/ensign/1975/11/news-of-the-church/elder-george-patrick-lee-of-the-first-quorum-of-the-seventy "Elder George Patrick Lee of the First Quorum of the Seventy"], ''[[Ensign (LDS magazine)|Ensign]]'', November 1975, pp. 136–37.</ref> Lee was transported to [[Orem, Utah|Orem]], [[Utah]], where he lived with the Glen and Joan Harker family. Lee remained in their home for seven years, returning to his Navajo family during summer vacations, until he graduated from [[Orem High School]] in 1962.
==Early adulthood== Lee attended [[Brigham Young University]], where he earned a [[bachelor's degree]] and later a [[doctorate]] in Educational Administration, and [[Utah State University]], where he completed a [[master's degree|master's]] degree.<ref name=Ensign/> In [[Arizona]], Lee taught at the [[Rough Rock Community School|Rough Rock Demonstration School]] and later served as president of the [[Ganado, Arizona|Ganado]] campus of [[Diné College]]. Lee married Katherine Hettich and they became the parents of seven children.
==Church service== After graduating from high school, Lee served as a [[Mormon missionary|missionary]] for the LDS Church to the [[Navajo Nation]], known then as the "Southwest Indian [[Mission (LDS Church)|Mission]]".
Prior to his call as an LDS [[general authority]], Lee held a number of [[Priesthood (Latter Day Saints)|priesthood]] leadership callings, including [[Elder (Latter Day Saints)|elders quorum president]], [[branch president]], [[district president]], and [[Mission president|president]] of the Arizona [[Holbrook, Arizona|Holbrook]] [[Mission (LDS Church)|Mission]].
On October 3, 1975, LDS Church [[President of the Church (LDS Church)|president]] [[Spencer W. Kimball]] called the 32-year-old Lee to be a member of the [[Seventy (LDS Church)|First Quorum of the Seventy]], a position with church-wide responsibilities. He was the first Native American [[general authority]] in church history.
==Excommunication and criminal conviction== On September 1, 1989, the Church announced that Lee had been [[excommunication|excommunicated]] for "[[apostasy]] and other conduct unbecoming a member of the Church."<ref>{{cite news|title=Disciplinary action taken Sept. 1 against general authority|url=http://199.104.95.22/articles/19067/Disciplinary-action-taken-Sept-1-against-general-authority.html|accessdate=28 July 2014|agency=LDS Church News|publisher=The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints |date=9 September 1989}}</ref> He was the first [[general authority]] to be excommunicated since 1943,<ref name = nytimes>[https://www.nytimes.com/1989/09/03/us/mormons-oust-first-indian-in-the-hierarchy.html "Mormons Oust First Indian in the Hierarchy"], ''[[The New York Times]]'', 1989-09-03.</ref> when [[Apostle (Latter Day Saints)|apostle]] [[Richard R. Lyman]] was excommunicated for [[adultery]] and unlawful cohabitation.<ref name = sltrib/>
According to Lee, the action stemmed from his disagreement with LDS Church [[President of the Church (LDS Church)|president]] [[Ezra Taft Benson]] over the role of [[Native Americans in the United States|Native Americans]] in the church. When he became church president, Benson had ended the church's [[Indian Placement Program]], which Lee cited as a key to his personal development. Lee argued that Benson was not treating [[Native Americans in the United States|Native American]] [[Latter-day Saints]] in the way that [[Spencer W. Kimball|Kimball]] would have approved. Additionally, Lee claimed the [[First Presidency (LDS Church)|First Presidency]] had accused him of [[plural marriage|polygamy]], immorality and teaching false doctrine. Lee provided copies of letters he had written to leaders of the LDS Church to the news media.<ref>{{citation |title= Press coverage of Lee's Excommunication Ambivalent |url= https://www.sunstonemagazine.com/wp-content/uploads/sbi/issues/072.pdf |journal= [[Sunstone (magazine)|Sunstone]] |date=August 1989 |pages= 47–49 }}</ref><ref>{{citation |title= [https://www.sunstonemagazine.com/wp-content/uploads/sbi/issues/072.pdf The Lee Letters] |journal= Sunstone |date=August 1989 |pages= 50–55}}</ref> The church did not publicly respond to Lee's letters or his public comments; it is the policy of the church not to publicize the details of an excommunicant's behavior which brought about the disciplinary action.
In 1993, the ''[[Salt Lake Tribune]]'' reported that Lee had attempted to [[child sexual abuse|sexually molest]] a minor girl in 1989, and that this was one of the reasons for Lee's excommunication. Initially, Lee denied the charges; however, on October 12, 1994, the ''Tribune'' reported:
{{quote|A year ago, former Mormon general authority George P. Lee proclaimed he was 'innocent before God' of sexually molesting a 12-year-old neighbor girl.
But Tuesday before a 3rd District judge, Lee humbly hung his head and admitted to touching the girl's breasts for sexual gratification ...
Lee, 51, pleaded guilty to attempted sexual abuse of a child, a third-degree [[felony]].<ref>''[[Salt Lake Tribune]]'', 1994-10-12</ref>}}
On July 27, 2007, Lee was arrested in [[Washington County, Utah]], for failing to [[Sex offender registries in the United States|register as a sex offender]] in the state of [[Utah]].<ref name = Spectrum>St. George ''Spectrum'', 29 July 2007.</ref><ref>Rebecca Palmer, [http://www.deseretnews.com/article/1,5143,695196389,00.html "Ex-LDS official arrested in sex-registry probe"], ''[[Deseret Morning News]]'', 2007-07-31, p. B5.</ref> The police reported that Lee had not [[sex offender registry|registered]] since 2001 and that he had been "living in an area with several young children in close proximity."<ref>Stephanie Coots, [http://washeriff.org/phpweb/index.php?module=announce&ANN_user_op=view&ANN_id=92 "New Sex Offender Program Nets Fourth Arrest"], 30 July 2007.</ref> Lee was booked into [[Purgatory Correctional Facility]] in [[Hurricane, Utah]] on $5,000 [[bail]].<ref name = Spectrum/> The case dragged on for many months due to Lee's health issues. On March 19, 2008 the case was formally dropped<ref>Ben Winslow [http://www.deseretnews.com/article/1,5143,695262990,00.html "Ex-LDS official's case is dropped by court"], ''[[Deseret Morning News]]'', 2008-03-19, online.</ref> due to these issues and Lee eventually registered with the sex offender registry. One year later, on March 29, 2009, Lee was removed from Utah's sex offender registry.<ref>[http://www.lapahie.com/George_Patrick_Lee.cfm#NoMore_Sex_Offender "George Patrick Lee"], lapahie.com.</ref>
==Death== Lee died in [[Provo, Utah|Provo]], [[Utah]] on July 28, 2010, from "a long battle with physical problems".<ref>Dan Metcalf Jr., [http://www.abc4.com/content/news/state/story/Former-LDS-general-authority-George-P-Lee-passes/5klYVFexmkKtuCn2VcqFug.cspx "Former LDS general authority George P. Lee passes away"], abc4.com, 2010-07-30.</ref> After his death, Latter-day Saint sociologist [[Armand Mauss]] described Lee as "one of the truly tragic figures in modern Mormon history".<ref name = sltrib/>
==Publications== * George P. Lee, ''Silent Courage: An Indian Story: The Autobiography of George P. Lee, a Navajo'', [[Deseret Book]]: Salt Lake City (1987).
==See also== * [[Ex-Mormon]] *[[James J. Hamula]]
==Notes== {{Reflist|2}}
==External links== *[http://www.gapages.com/leegp1.htm Grampa Bill's G.A. Pages: George P. Lee] *[http://www.lapahie.com/George_Patrick_Lee.cfm "George Patrick Lee"], lapahie.com
{{Authority control}}

{{Infobox person |name = Gustavo Brambila |image = |alt = |caption = |birth_date = 1953 |birth_place = [[Jalisco, Mexico]] |death_date = |death_place = |other_names = |known_for = |occupation = Winemaker |nationality = Mexican American }}'''Gustavo Brambila''' (1953 - ) is a Mexican-American winemaker in the [[Napa Valley]]. He was portrayed in the movie ''[[Bottle Shock]]'', although he was not actually involved with the 1976 [[Judgement of Paris (wine)|Judgement of Paris]] blind [[wine tasting]].
==Early life== He was born in [[Jalisco, Mexico]] in 1953 and moved with his family to [[Rutherford, California|Rutherford]] in the [[Napa Valley]] in 1957.<ref name="app">{{cite web|url=http://wine.appellationamerica.com/wine-review/614/Bottle-Shocked.html|title=Bottle Shocked: Uncorking the Real Gustavo Brambila|last=Goldfarb|first=Alan|date=August 27, 2008|publisher=Appellation America|accessdate=2009-03-28}}</ref>
==Career== Brambila earned a degree in fermentation science at the [[University of California, Davis Department of Viticulture and Enology|University of California, Davis]], one of the first Latinos to do so.<ref name="visimag"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m3488/is_1_83/ai_82482104/pg_3?tag=content;col1|title=The changing face of the California wine industry|last=Caputo|first=Tina|date=January 2002|publisher=Bnet.com|accessdate=2009-03-29}}</ref> In 1976 he was hired by [[Mike Grgich]] at [[Chateau Montelena]] where he assisted in quality control. He joined just after the events covered in ''[[Bottle Shock]]''. Brambila followed Grgich when [[Grgich Hills Cellar]] was created in 1977. He worked there for 23 years before leaving in 1999 to become the general manager and winemaker at Peju Province Winery.<ref name="taylor">{{cite web|url=http://www.taylorfamilyvineyards.com/TFV-%20Winemaker%20Bios.pdf |title=Winemaker Bios: Gustavo Brambila |publisher=Taylor Vinyards |accessdate=2009-03-28 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110716193603/http://www.taylorfamilyvineyards.com/TFV-%20Winemaker%20Bios.pdf |archivedate=2011-07-16 |df= }}</ref>
In 1996, he teamed up with Thrace Bromberger to form Gustavo Wine, which was making 3,800 cases in 2004 and 7,000 cases in 2008. <ref name=app/><ref name=sfgate/> They produce a mix of Merlot, Zinfandel, Sauvignon Blanc, Barbera, Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon. They also own the Napa Wine Merchants cooperative tasting room as well as several thousand acres in the Chiles Valley.<ref name=sfgate>{{cite web|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2004/10/07/WIGJD94HQC1.DTL|title=Labels with roots in Mexico: 13 companies represent a groundswell of Latino winemakers|last=Emert|first=Carol|date=October 7, 2004|publisher=San Francisco Chronicle|pages=F-3|accessdate=2009-03-29}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ilovenapa.com/paulfranson_article.php?articleId=38|title=Mexican families make name in wine business after toiling in the background|last=Franson|first=Paul|date=January 6, 2003|publisher=ilovenapa.com|accessdate=2009-03-29}}</ref>
Since 2002, he has consulted with Taylor Family Vineyards on their [[Cabernet Sauvignon]].<ref name=taylor/> In 2008, he began crafting private label wines for the Wine Pod, an automated wine presser and fermenter.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.prxinc.com/winepod_files/WinePod_GT.pdf|title=WinePod Announces Partnership with Napa’s Gustavo Thrace Winery|date=November 7, 2008|publisher=Winepod.com|accessdate=2009-03-29|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110715125132/http://www.prxinc.com/winepod_files/WinePod_GT.pdf|archivedate=July 15, 2011|df=}}</ref>
==Bottle Shock== Brambila was portrayed by [[Freddy Rodriguez (actor)|Freddy Rodriguez]] in the 2008 indie film ''[[Bottle Shock]]''. In the film, the character is directly involved in the 1976 tasting although in reality, he was not. He worked in the lab on quality control.<ref name="app"/> Brambila spent time with Rodriguez before filming.<ref name=visimag>{{cite web|url=http://www.visimag.com/exclusive/fb517_bs.htm|title=The Movie: Bottle Shock|last=Sloane|first=Judy|publisher=Visimag.com|accessdate=2009-03-29}}</ref> Since the film was released, there has been a noticeable increase in business at his winery.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.freestylereleasing.com/news.htm|title=Indie Film Hit BOTTLE SHOCK" Defies Industry Expectations & Means Good Business For Wine Country|date=September 17, 2008|publisher=Freestyle Releasing|accessdate=2009-03-29|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090221152506/http://www.freestylereleasing.com/news.htm|archivedate=February 21, 2009|df=}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|2}}
==External links==

{{EngvarB|date=December 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2017}} {{BLP sources|date=January 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Ian Puleston-Davies | image = | img_size = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1958|09|06}} | birth_place = [[Flint, Flintshire|Flint]], Flintshire, Wales | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Actor | television = [[Coronation Street]] (2010–2015) | years_active = 1983–present | spouse = }}
'''Ian Puleston-Davies''' (born 6 September 1958) is a [[Welsh people|Welsh]] actor and writer.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/showbiz-and-lifestyle/showbiz/2010/08/22/puleston-davies-my-battle-to-beat-ocd-91466-27111588/ |title=Puleston-Davies: My battle to beat OCD |author=Mainwaring, Rachel |accessdate=2 December 2010 |date=22 August 2010 |work=[[Media Wales#WalesOnline|publisher=[[Media Wales]] Ltd |WalesOnline]] website }}</ref> He is best known for his role as King Thistle from [[Ben & Holly's Little Kingdom]] and builder [[Owen Armstrong]] in the [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]] soap opera ''[[Coronation Street]]'' from 2010 to 2015. In November 2014, ITV announced that Puleston-Davies had quit his role as Owen Armstrong in ''Coronation Street'', and his character departed from the show on 15 April 2015.
==Early life and career== Born in [[Flint, Flintshire|Flint]], north [[Wales]], Puleston-Davies starred in the [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]] drama ''[[Vincent (TV series)|Vincent]]'' alongside [[Ray Winstone]] and in ''[[Ghostboat]]'' (also for ITV) alongside [[David Jason]]. He also played the lead roles in ''[[Conviction (2004 TV series)|Conviction]]'' and the [[BBC Three]] series ''[[Funland]]''.
He has starred in long-running dramas such as ''[[Holby City]]'', ''[[The Bill]]'', ''[[Hollyoaks]]'' and ''[[Brookside]]''. He has also made special appearances in ''[[Hustle (TV series)|Hustle]]'', ''[[Life on Mars (UK TV series)|Life on Mars]]'', ''[[Dalziel and Pascoe (TV series)|Dalziel and Pascoe]]'', ''[[Silent Witness]]'', ''[[I'm Alan Partridge]]'', and ''[[Cape Wrath (TV series)|Cape Wrath]]''. In 2007, he starred in the [[Channel 4]] docudrama, ''Richard Is My Boyfriend''.
In 2009, Puleston-Davies was chosen to play the voiceover part of King Thistle in the children's animated television series ''[[Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom]]''.
From September to October 2010, he played the role of Charlie Fisher in the sixth series of the [[BBC One]] drama, ''[[Waterloo Road (TV series)|Waterloo Road]]''.<ref>[http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s24/waterloo-road/news/a257031/ian-puleston-davies-joins-waterloo-road.html Ian Puleston-Davies joins Waterloo Road]</ref>
In 2010, Puleston-Davies joined ''[[Coronation Street]]'' as cast regular, Owen Armstrong. He quit the show in November 2014, and his on-screen character departed in April 2015.
In 2005, he co-wrote the drama ''[[Dirty Filthy Love]]'' based upon his own experiences dealing with [[obsessive compulsive disorder]].<ref name="times"/> ''Dirty Filthy Love'' won a [[Royal Television Society]] Award for Best Single Drama<ref name="times">{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/life_and_style/health/features/article526798.ece|title=Looking fear in the face|work=[[The Times]]|date=28 May 2005|accessdate=22 September 2007 | location=London | first=Rosie | last=Millard | authorlink=Rosie Millard}}</ref> and was nominated for the [[British Academy Television Awards|BAFTA Award]] for "Best Single Drama".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/4345533.stm|title=Bafta TV Awards 2005|publisher=BBC|date=17 April 2005|accessdate=22 September 2007}}</ref>
Puleston-Davies is the patron of Red Dot Drama, an acting workshop group that was formed by [[Helena Little]], a friend of his from the [[Guildhall School of Music and Drama]]. He is also patron of the CALM Centre, a charity that provides counseling and therapeutic services to the community of Harlow and its environs. Ian has spoken at length about his personal struggles with Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder, making a documentary for BBC Wales in 2017; he also supports the work of the national charity OCD-UK, where he is an active patron frequently presenting at their annual conferences.
==Personal life== Puleston-Davies lives in Cheshire with his partner, Sue, and their two children, Maggie and Charlie.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/tv/tv-news/coronation-street-star-ian-puleston-davies-3340970|title=Coronation Street star Ian Puleston-Davies: 'How fellow cast members help me control my OCD on set'|work=Mirror|author=Crawford, Sue|date=2 April 2014|accessdate=1 April 2017}}</ref> He is the cousin of former World Champion kickboxer, Russ Williams.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chesterstandard.co.uk/news/150201/watch-flintshire-actor-in-hilarious-spoof-martial-arts-challenge-with-seven-year-old.aspx|title=WATCH: Flintshire actor in hilarious spoof martial arts challenge with seven-year-old|publisher=Chester Standard|date=13 July 2015|accessdate=1 April 2017}}</ref>
==Selected credits==
